parameter.help: The pathname of the file to read.

parameter.name: filename
parameter.help: The pathname of the file that is written.

parameter.name: columns
parameter.help: Column number or range of columns. Specify a single number, a hypen-separated column range, a comma-separated list, or any combination of these; for example: 1,3-6,9.

parameter.name: columnnames
parameter.help: Comma-separated column names.

parameter.name: query
parameter.help: â€¢ read action: The query in which to store the converted spreadsheet file. You must specify format, name , or query. â€¢ write and update actions: A query variable containing the data to write. You must specify name or query.

parameter.name: sheet
parameter.help: Number of the sheet.

parameter.name: headerrow
parameter.help: Row number that contains column names.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: read action: The variable in which to store the spreadsheet file data. You must specify name or query.if format='csv' then name will contain csv variable. if format='html' then name will contain html content. write and update actions: A variable containing CSV-format data or an ColdFusion spreadsheet object containing the data to write. You must specify name or query.

parameter.name: format
parameter.help: Format of the data represented by the name variable.

tag.name: cfmediaplayer
tag.help: Creates an in-built media player that lets you play FLV files

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Width of the media player, in pixels.

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: Height of the media player, in pixels.

parameter.name: fullscreencontrol
parameter.help: Whether full screen is enabled

parameter.name: hideBorder
parameter.help: A Boolean value that specifies if you want to hide border for the media player panel

parameter.name: controlbar
parameter.help: A Boolean value that specifies if you want to display the control panel for the media player

parameter.name: align
parameter.help: Specifies the vertical alignment of the media player.

parameter.name: onload
parameter.help: Custom JavaScript function to run on loading th player component.

parameter.name: bgcolor
parameter.help: The background color of the media player specified as a Hexadecimal value without a "#"

parameter.name: source
parameter.help: The URL to the FLV file.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of the media player. The name attribute is required when you invoke JavaScript functions.

parameter.name: quality
parameter.help: The quality of the media playback

parameter.name: hideTitle
parameter.help: A Boolean value that specifies if you want to hide title for the media player panel

parameter.name: oncomplete
parameter.help: Custom JavaScript function to run when the FLV file has finished playing.

parameter.name: onstart
parameter.help: Custom JavaScript function to run when the FLV file starts playing.

parameter.name: wmode
parameter.help: Specifies the absolute positioning and layering capabilities in your browser

parameter.name: autoPlay
parameter.help: A Boolean value that specifies if the media player should automatically play the FLV file on loading the CFM page.

parameter.name: style
parameter.help: Specify style for mediaplayer

tag.name: cffileupload
tag.help: Ajax File upload

parameter.name: url
parameter.help: The URL to the server where the files are uploaded.

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Width of the file upload control, in pixels.

parameter.name: title
parameter.help: Title for the upload dialog.

parameter.name: extensionfilter
parameter.help: Use this attribute to specify the type of file that you will allow to be uploaded. For example, to let only image files to be uploaded, you can specify file extensions like .jpg, .jpeg, or .png

parameter.name: uploadbuttonlabel
parameter.help: Label of the Upload button.

parameter.name: progressbar
parameter.help: Whether to display Progress Bar or not. Default true

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: Height of the file upload control, in pixels.

parameter.name: maxUploadSize
parameter.help: The maximum file size, in mega bytes, allowed for the upload. Default 10MB.

parameter.name: maxFileSelect
parameter.help: The maximum number of files allowed for the upload.

parameter.name: style
parameter.help: A CSS style specification that defines layout styles

parameter.name: bgcolor
parameter.help: The background color for the file upload control. A hexadecimal value without â€œ#â€� prefixed.

parameter.name: addButtonLabel
parameter.help: Label of the Add button

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of the file upload component.

parameter.name: oncomplete
parameter.help: The JavaScript function to run after the file upload completes

parameter.name: onerror
parameter.help: The JavaScript function to run on an error condition. The error can be a network error or server-side error

parameter.name: clearButtonLabel
parameter.help: Label of the Clear button

parameter.name: deleteButtonLabel
parameter.help: Label of the Delete button

parameter.name: align
parameter.help: Specifies the default alignment

parameter.name: wmode
parameter.help: Specifies the absolute positioning and layering capabilities in your browser:

parameter.name: stopOnError
parameter.help: Specifies whether or not to ignore the exceptions for this operation. When the value is true, it stops uploading, displays an appropriate error

parameter.name: hideUploadButton
parameter.help: A Boolean value that specifies if the Upload button should appear in the media player

parameter.name: onUploadComplete
parameter.help: The JavaScript function to run after the all uploads have completed

tag.name: cfsharepoint
tag.help: Invokes a feature that SharePoint exposes as a web service action, such as the Document Workspace getdwsdata action.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: The password required to connect to the SharePoint server. Required if you do not specify a login attribute.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: The name of a web service action. See Usage for the list of service actions you can specify.

parameter.name: login
parameter.help: A structure containing user, password, and domain login credentials to pass to the service. If you do not specify domain ,password, and userNameattributes you must specify a login structure with domain, password, and userName entries.

parameter.name: params
parameter.help: A structure containing names and values of the parameters to pass to the service.

parameter.name: domain
parameter.help: The domain name required to connect to the SharePoint server. Required if you do not specify a login attribute.

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: The user name required to connect to the SharePoint server. Required if you do not specify a login attribute.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of the result variable in which to put the data returned by the SharePoint service.

parameter.name: wsdl
parameter.help: Path to the service wsdl file. Required to invoke an action that is not in the list of supported actions. See Usage for details.

tag.name: cfmapitem
tag.help: This tag creates markers on the map.

parameter.name: longitude
parameter.help: The longitude value for the marker, in degrees.

parameter.name: address
parameter.help: The address of the location to set the map marker.

parameter.name: tip
parameter.help: A short description of the marker location that appears as a tool tip.

parameter.name: latitude
parameter.help: The latitude value for the marker, in degrees.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name of the map.

parameter.name: showMarkerWindow
parameter.help: When true, the marker infowindow is shown. By default, this is false. This is inherited by all cfmapitem tags.

parameter.name: markerWindowContent
parameter.help: Static inner html markup to be displayed in the infowindow opened when the marker is clicked. This is mutually exclusive with the markerbind attribute

parameter.name: markerIcon
parameter.help: Location of an image file to use as the marker icon. The attributes markericon and markercolor are mutually exclusive.

parameter.name: markerColor
parameter.help: Indicates the color of the marker.

tag.name: cfmap
tag.help: Embeds a Google map within a ColdFusion web page

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Map width, in pixels.

parameter.name: centerlongitude
parameter.help: The longitude value for the location, in degrees

parameter.name: centeraddress
parameter.help: The address of the location, which is set as the center of the map.

parameter.name: continuouszoom
parameter.help: Whether to provide zoom control that enables smooth zooming for the map

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Type of the Google map

parameter.name: title
parameter.help: Title of the panel

parameter.name: zoomcontrol
parameter.help: Whether to enable zoom control

parameter.name: tip
parameter.help: A short description of the center location that appears as a tool tip.

parameter.name: overview
parameter.help: Whether to add an Overview panel to the map

parameter.name: hideborder
parameter.help: Whether to hide border for surrounding panel

parameter.name: doubleclickzoom
parameter.help: Whether to enable double-click zoom

parameter.name: key
parameter.help: The API key of the map.

parameter.name: collapsible
parameter.help: Whether to provide a collapsible property for the surrounding panel

parameter.name: zoomlevel
parameter.help: Specifies the starting zoom value

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: Height of the map, in pixels

parameter.name: centerlatitude
parameter.help: The latitude value for the location, in degrees.

parameter.name: onload
parameter.help: Custom JavaScript function that runs after the map loads..

parameter.name: typecontrol
parameter.help: What type of typecontrol to provide. Basic inclueds "map, satellite, hybrid" and Advanced includes "map, satellite, hybrid, earth, terrain"

parameter.name: displayscale
parameter.help: Whether to enable scale control

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of the map.

parameter.name: scrollwheelzoom
parameter.help: Whether to enable mouse wheel zooming control

parameter.name: markerBind
parameter.help: Uses a bind expression to fetch markup to be displayed in the infowindow opened when the marker is clicked. This is mutually exclusive with the markerwindowtext attribute. This is inherited by all cfmapitem tags

parameter.name: showMarkerWindow
parameter.help: When true, the marker infowindow is shown. By default, this is false. This is inherited by all cfmapitem tags.

parameter.name: markerWindowContent
parameter.help: Static inner html markup to be displayed in the infowindow opened when the marker is clicked. This is mutually exclusive with the markerbind attribute

parameter.name: markerIcon
parameter.help: Location of the icon to use for the marker.

parameter.name: markerColor
parameter.help: marker color in hexadecimal value.

parameter.name: onError
parameter.help: The JavaScript function to run when there is a Google map API error. The JavaScript function is passed with two parameters, Google map status code and error message.

parameter.name: showCenterMarker
parameter.help: Whether to display the marker icon that identifies the map center

parameter.name: showScale
parameter.help: Whether to show scale control

tag.name: cfmessagebox
tag.help: Creates MessageBox

parameter.name: labelcancel
parameter.help: The text to put on the cancel button of a prompt message box.

parameter.name: callbackHandler
parameter.help: callback function which will be called when any ok|no|cancel button is clicked

parameter.name: labelok
parameter.help: The text to put on a alert button and prompt messge box OK button.

parameter.name: title
parameter.help: The title for the message box.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Type of action to be performed

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Message text which will be displayed

parameter.name: labelno
parameter.help: The text to put on the button used for a negative response in a confirm message box.

parameter.name: labelyes
parameter.help: The text to put on the button used for a positive responsein a confirm message box.

parameter.name: multiline
parameter.help: Applies for prompt action only. Signify whether prompt is textarea(multiliner) or oneliner(textField)Default=false

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of the messageBox

parameter.name: bodyStyle
parameter.help: A CSS style specification for the body of the message box. As a general rule, use this attribute to set color and font styles

parameter.name: buttonType
parameter.help: Applies to the control type - confirm The buttons to display on the message box

parameter.name: icon
parameter.help: Specifies the following CSS classes error: Provides the error icon. You can use this icon when displaying error messages. info: Provides the info icon. You can use this icon when displaying any information. question: Provides the question icon. You can use this icon in a confirmation message box that prompts a user response. warning: Provides the warning icon. You can use this icon when displaying a warning message

parameter.name: modal
parameter.help: A Boolean value that specifies if the message box should be a modal window

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Width of the message box in pixels.

parameter.name: x
parameter.help: The X (horizontal) coordinate of the upper-left corner of the message box . ColdFusion ignores this attribute if you do not set the y attribute.

parameter.name: y
parameter.help: The Y (vertical) coordinate of the upper-left corner of the message box. ColdFusion ignores this attribute if you do not set the x attribute.

function.name: abs
function.help: Absolute-value function. The absolute value of a number is the number without its sign.

function.name: acos
function.help: Returns the angle whose cosine is the value passed as the argument.

parameter.name: number
parameter.help: The value to be converted into an angle. Must be between -1 and 1.

function.name: ajaxLink
function.help: Causes an HTML href attribute to display link results in the current Ajax container.

parameter.name: url
parameter.help: The URL of the link.

function.name: ajaxOnLoad
function.help: Causes the specified JavaScript function to run when the page loads.

parameter.name: functionname
parameter.help: The name of the function to run when the page loads.

function.name: arrayContains
function.help: Returns true if specified object is present is given array

function.name: arrayDelete
function.help: Deletes specified object from given array

function.name: arrayMax
function.help: Returns the largest numeric value in an array. If the array parameter value is an empty array, returns zero. All elements must contain values that can be automatically converted to numeric values.

function.name: arrayMin
function.help: Returns the smallest numeric value in an array. If the array parameter value is an empty array, returns zero. All elements must contain values that can be automatically converted to numeric values.

function.name: arraylen
function.help: Determines the number of elements in an array. CFML MX: this function can be used on child XML objects.

function.name: arrayAppend
function.help: Appends an array element to an array.

parameter.name: array
parameter.help: The array to which the element should be appended.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: The element to append. Can be any type.

function.name: arrayAvg
function.help: Calculates the average of the values in an array. All elements in the array must contain values that can be automatically converted to numeric.

function.name: arrayClear
function.help: Removes all elements from an array.

function.name: arrayNew
function.help: Creates an array of 1-3 dimensions. Index array elements with square brackets: [ ]. CFML arrays expand dynamically as data is added.

function.name: arrayPrepend
function.help: Inserts an array element at the beginning of an array and shifts the positions of the existing elements to make room.

function.name: arrayResize
function.help: Resets an array to a specified minimum number of elements. This can improve performance, if used to size an array to its expected maximum. For more than 500 elements, use ArrayResize immediately after using the ArrayNew tag.

function.name: arraySet
function.help: In a one-dimensional array, sets the elements in a specified index range to a value. Useful for initializing an array after a call to ArrayNew.

function.name: arraySort
function.help: Sorts array elements numerically or alphanumerically.

parameter.name: array
parameter.help: Name of an array

parameter.name: sort_type
parameter.help:
numeric: sorts numbers text: sorts text alphabetically, taking case into account (also known as case sensitive). All letters of one case precede the first letter of the other case: - aabzABZ, if sort_order = "asc" (ascending sort) - ZBAzbaa, if sort_order = "desc" (descending sort)
textnocase: sorts text alphabetically, without regard to case (also known as case-insensitive). A letter in varying cases precedes the next letter: - aAaBbBzzZ, in an ascending sort; preserves original intra-letter order - ZzzBbBaAa, in a descending sort; reverses original intra-letter order

parameter.name: sort_order
parameter.help:
asc: ascending sort order. Default. - aabzABZ or aAaBbBzzZ, depending on value of sort_type, for letters - from smaller to larger, for numbers
desc: descending sort order. - ZBAzbaa or ZzzBbBaAa, depending on value of sort_type, for letters - from larger to smaller, for numbers

function.name: arraySum
function.help: The sum of values in an array. If the array parameter value is an empty array, returns zero.

function.name: arraySwap
function.help: Swaps array values of an array at specified positions. This function is more efficient than multiple cfset tags

function.name: arrayToList
function.help: Converts a one-dimensional array to a list.

function.name: asc
function.help: Determines the value of a character.

function.name: asin
function.help: Determines the arcsine of a number. The arcsine is the angle whose sine is number.

function.name: atn
function.help: Arctangent function. The arctangent is the angle whose tangent is number.

function.name: binaryDecode
function.help: Converts a string to a binary object. Used to convert binary data that has been encoded into string format back into binary data.

parameter.name: String
parameter.help: A string containing encoded binary data.

parameter.name: binaryencoding
parameter.help: A string specifying the algorithm used to encode the original binary data into a string; must be one of the following: - hex: characters 0-9 and A-F represent the hexadecimal value of each byte; for example, 3A. - UU: data is encoded using the UNIX UUencode algorithm. - base64: data is encoded using the Base64 algorithm.

function.name: binaryEncode
function.help: Converts binary data to a string.

parameter.name: binarydata
parameter.help: A string containing encoded binary data.

parameter.name: encoding
parameter.help: A string specifying the encoding method to use to represent the data; one of the following: - hex: use characters 0-9 and A-F represent the hexadecimal value of each byte; for example, 3A. - UU: use the UNIX UUencode algorithm to convert the data. - base64: use the Base64 algorithm to convert the data.

function.name: bitAnd
function.help: Performs a bitwise logical AND operation.

function.name: bitMaskClear
function.help: Performs a bitwise mask clear operation.

function.name: bitMaskRead
function.help: Performs a bitwise mask read operation. Returns an integer, created from length bits of number, beginning at start.

function.name: bitMaskSet
function.help: Performs a bitwise mask set operation.

function.name: bitNot
function.help: Performs a bitwise logical NOT operation.

function.name: bitOr
function.help: Performs a bitwise logical OR operation.

function.name: bitShln
function.help: Performs a bitwise shift-left, no-rotation operation.

function.name: bitShrn
function.help: Performs a bitwise shift-right, no-rotation operation.

function.name: bitXor
function.help: Performs a bitwise logical XOR operation.

function.name: ceiling
function.help: Determines the closest integer that is greater than a specified number.

function.name: charsetDecode
function.help: Converts as string to a binary representation.

parameter.name: String
parameter.help: A string containing data to encode in binary format.

parameter.name: encoding
parameter.help: A string specifying encoding of the input data.

function.name: charsetEncode
function.help: Uses the specified encoding to convert binary data to a string.

parameter.name: binaryobject
parameter.help: A variable containing binary data to decode into text.

parameter.name: encoding
parameter.help: The character encoding that was used to encode the string into binary format.

function.name: chr
function.help: Converts a numeric value to a UCS-2 character.

function.name: cjustify
function.help: Centers a string in a field length.

function.name: compare
function.help: Performs a case-sensitive comparison of two strings. -1, if string1 is less than string2 0, if string1 is equal to string2 1, if string1 is greater than string2

function.name: compareNoCase
function.help: Performs a case-insensitive comparison of two strings. An indicator of the difference: A negative number, if string1 is less than string2 0, if string1 is equal to string2 A positive number, if string1 is greater than string2

function.name: cos
function.help: Calculates the cosine of an angle that is entered in radians. A number; the cosine of the angle.

function.name: createDate
function.help: Creates a date/time object

function.name: createDateTime
function.help: Creates a date-time object.

function.name: createObject
function.help:
The CreateObject function takes different arguments depending on the value of the first argument:
CreateObject('com', class, context, serverName) CreateObject('component', component-name) CreateObject( context, class, locale) CreateObject('java', class) CreateObject('webservice', urltowsdl, [, portname])

parameter.name: urltowsdl
parameter.help: WSDL file URL; location of web service

parameter.name: portname
parameter.help: The port name for the web service. This value is case-sensitive and corresponds to the port element's name attribute under the service element. Specify this parameter if the web service contains multiple ports. If no port name is specified, ColdFusion uses the first port found in the WSDL.

function.name: createODBCDate
function.help: Creates an ODBC date object.

function.name: createODBCDateTime
function.help: Creates an ODBC date-time object.

function.name: createODBCTime
function.help: Creates an ODBC time object.

function.name: createTime
function.help: Creates a time variable.

function.name: createTimespan
function.help: Creates a date/time object that defines a time period. You can add or subtract it from other date/time objects and use it with the cachedWithin attribute of cfquery.

function.name: createUUID
function.help: Creates a Universally Unique Identifier (UUID). A UUID is a 35-character string representation of a unique 128-bit integer xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx : x is a hexadecimal digit

function.name: dateAdd
function.help: Adds units of time to a date. [datepart - quicky] yyyy: Year; q: Quarter; m: Month; y: Day of year; d: Day w: Weekday; ww: Week; h: Hour; n: Minute; s: Second; l: Millisecond

function.name: dateCompare
function.help: Performs a full date/time comparison of two dates. -1, if date1 is less than date2 0, if date1 is equal to date2 1, if date1 is greater than date2 [datepart - quicky] yyyy: Year; q: Quarter; m: Month; y: Day of year; d: Day w: Weekday; ww: Week; h: Hour; n: Minute; s: Second; l: Millisecond

function.name: dateConvert
function.help: Converts local time to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), or UTC to local time. The function uses the daylight savings settings in the executing computer to compute daylight savings time, if required. [type - quicky] local2Utc: Converts local time to UTC time. utc2Local: Converts UTC time to local time

function.name: dateDiff
function.help: Determines the integer number of units by which date1 is less than date2. [datepart - quicky] yyyy: Year; q: Quarter; m: Month; y: Day of year; d: Day w: Weekday; ww: Week; h: Hour; n: Minute; s: Second; l: Millisecond

function.name: dateFormat
function.help: Formats a date value using U.S. date formats. For international date support, use LSDateFormat. [mask - quicky] d,dd,ddd,dddd: Day of month / week m,mm,mmm,mmmm: Month; y,yy,yyyy: Year; gg: Period/era string short / medium / long / full

function.name: datePart
function.help: Extracts a part from a date value as a numeric. [datepart - quicky] yyyy: Year; q: Quarter; m: Month; y: Day of year; d: Day w: Weekday; ww: Week; h: Hour; n: Minute; s: Second; l: Millisecond

function.name: day
function.help: Determines the day of the month, in a date. The ordinal for the day of the month, ranging from 1 to 31.

function.name: dayOfWeek
function.help: Determines the day of the week, in a date.

function.name: dayOfWeekAsString
function.help: Determines the day of the week as a string from 1-7

function.name: dayOfYear
function.help: Determines the day of the year, in a date.

function.name: daysInMonth
function.help: Determines the number of days in a month.

function.name: daysInYear
function.help: Determines the number of days in a year.

function.name: de
function.help: Postpones evaluation of a string as an expression, when it is passed as a parameter to the IIf or Evaluate functions. Escapes any double quotation marks in the parameter and wraps the result in double quotation marks.

function.name: decimalFormat
function.help: Converts a number to a decimal-formatted string.

function.name: decrementValue
function.help: Decrements the integer part of a number.

function.name: decrypt
function.help: Decrypts a string that is encrypted with the Encrypt function.

parameter.name: encrypted_string
parameter.help: String to decrypt.

parameter.name: key
parameter.help: Key or seed used to encrypt the string. * For the CFMX_COMPAT algorithm, any combination of any number of characters; used as a seed used to generate a 32-bit encryption key. * For all other algorithms, a key in the format used by the algorithm. For these algorithms, use the GenerateSecretKey function to generate the key.

parameter.name: algorithm
parameter.help: The algorithm to use to decrypt the string. Must be the same as the algorithm used to encrypt the string. * CFMX_COMPAT: the algorithm used in ColdFusion MX and prior releases. This algorithm is the least secure option (default). * AES: the Advanced Encryption Standard specified by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) FIPS-197. * BLOWFISH: the Blowfish algorithm defined by Bruce Schneier. * DES: the Data Encryption Standard algorithm defined by NIST FIPS-46-3. * DESEDE: the "Triple DES" algorithm defined by NIST FIPS-46-3.

parameter.name: encoding
parameter.help: The binary encoding used to represent the data as a string. Must be the same as the algorithm used to encrypt the string. * Base64: the Base64 algorithm, as specified by IETF RFC 2045. * Hex: the characters A-F and 0-9 represent the hexadecimal byte values. * UU: the UNIX standard UUEncode algorithm (default). If you specify this parameter, you must also specify the algorithm parameter.

function.name: decryptBinary
function.help: Decrypts encrypted binary data with the specified key, value, algorithm, salt, and iterations.

parameter.name: bytes
parameter.help: Binary data to decrypt.

parameter.name: key
parameter.help: Key or seed used to encrypt the string. * For the CFMX_COMPAT algorithm, any combination of any number of characters; used as a seed used to generate a 32-bit encryption key. * For all other algorithms, a key in the format used by the algorithm. For these algorithms, use the GenerateSecretKey function to generate the key.

parameter.name: algorithm
parameter.help: The algorithm to use to decrypt the string. Must be the same as the algorithm used to encrypt the string. * CFMX_COMPAT: the algorithm used in ColdFusion MX and prior releases. This algorithm is the least secure option (default). * AES: the Advanced Encryption Standard specified by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) FIPS-197. * BLOWFISH: the Blowfish algorithm defined by Bruce Schneier. * DES: the Data Encryption Standard algorithm defined by NIST FIPS-46-3. * DESEDE: the "Triple DES" algorithm defined by NIST FIPS-46-3.

parameter.name: ivorsalt
parameter.help: Specify this parameter to adjust ColdFusion encryption to match the details of other encryption software. If you specify this parameter, you must also specify the algorithm parameter. * For Block Encryption Algorithms: This is the binary Initialization Vector value to use with the algorithm. The algorithm must contain a Feedback Mode other than ECB. This must be a binary value that is exactly the same size as the algorithm block size. * For Password Based Encryption Algorithms: This is the binary Salt value to transform the password into a key.

parameter.name: iterations
parameter.help: The number of iterations to transform the password into a binary key. Specify this parameter to adjust ColdFusion encryption to match the details of other encryption software. If you specify this parameter, you must also specify the algorithm parameter with a Password Based Encryption (PBE) algorithm. Do not specify this parameter for Block Encryption Algorithms. You must use the same value to encrypt and decrypt the data. * For Password Based Encryption Algorithms: This is the binary Salt value to transform the password into a key.

function.name: deleteClientVariable
function.help: Deletes a client variable. (To test for the existence of a variable, use IsDefined.)

function.name: deserializeJSON
function.help: Converts a JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) string data representation into CFML data, such as a CFML structure or array.

parameter.name: jsonvar
parameter.help: A string that contains a valid JSON construct, or variable that represents one.

parameter.name: strictmapping
parameter.help: A Boolean value that specifies whether to convert the JSON strictly.

function.name: directoryExists
function.help: Determines whether a directory exists.

function.name: directoryCreate
function.help: Creates new directory for specified path

function.name: directoryList
function.help: Lists the directory and returns the list of files under it as array or query

function.name: directoryDelete
function.help: Deltes directory for given path

function.name: directoryRename
function.help: Renames given directory

function.name: directorySize
function.help: Returns size of given directory

function.name: dollarFormat
function.help: Formats a string in U.S. format. (For other currencies, use LSCurrencyFormat or LSEuroCurrencyFormat.)

function.name: duplicate
function.help: Returns a clone, also known as a deep copy, of a variable or XML object. There is no reference to the original variable.

function.name: encrypt
function.help: Encrypts a string. Uses a symmetric key-based algorithm, in which the same key is used to encrypt and decrypt a string. The security of the encrypted string depends on maintaining the secrecy of the key. Uses an XOR-based algorithm that uses a pseudo-random 32-bit key, based on a seed passed by the user as a function parameter.

parameter.name: String
parameter.help: String to encrypt.

parameter.name: key
parameter.help: Key or seed used to encrypt the string. * For the CFMX_COMPAT algorithm, any combination of any number of characters; used as a seed used to generate a 32-bit encryption key. * For all other algorithms, a key in the format used by the algorithm. For these algorithms, use the GenerateSecretKey function to generate the key.

parameter.name: algorithm
parameter.help: The algorithm to use to encrypt the string. * CFMX_COMPAT: the algorithm used in ColdFusion MX and prior releases. This algorithm is the least secure option (default). * AES: the Advanced Encryption Standard specified by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) FIPS-197. * BLOWFISH: the Blowfish algorithm defined by Bruce Schneier. * DES: the Data Encryption Standard algorithm defined by NIST FIPS-46-3. * DESEDE: the "Triple DES" algorithm defined by NIST FIPS-46-3.

parameter.name: encoding
parameter.help: The binary encoding used to represent the data as a string. Must be the same as the algorithm used to encrypt the string. * Base64: the Base64 algorithm, as specified by IETF RFC 2045. * Hex: the characters A-F and 0-9 represent the hexadecimal byte values. * UU: the UNIX standard UUEncode algorithm (default). If you specify this parameter, you must also specify the algorithm parameter.

function.name: encryptBinary
function.help: Encrypts binary data using a specific algorithm and encoding method.

parameter.name: bytes
parameter.help: Bindary data to encrypt.

parameter.name: key
parameter.help: Key or seed used to encrypt the string. * For the CFMX_COMPAT algorithm, any combination of any number of characters; used as a seed used to generate a 32-bit encryption key. * For all other algorithms, a key in the format used by the algorithm. For these algorithms, use the GenerateSecretKey function to generate the key.

parameter.name: algorithm
parameter.help: The algorithm to use to encrypt the string. * CFMX_COMPAT: the algorithm used in ColdFusion MX and prior releases. This algorithm is the least secure option (default). * AES: the Advanced Encryption Standard specified by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) FIPS-197. * BLOWFISH: the Blowfish algorithm defined by Bruce Schneier. * DES: the Data Encryption Standard algorithm defined by NIST FIPS-46-3. * DESEDE: the "Triple DES" algorithm defined by NIST FIPS-46-3.

parameter.name: ivorsalt
parameter.help: Specify this parameter to adjust ColdFusion encryption to match the details of other encryption software. If you specify this parameter, you must also specify the algorithm parameter. * For Block Encryption Algorithms: This is the binary Initialization Vector value to use with the algorithm. The algorithm must contain a Feedback Mode other than ECB. This must be a binary value that is exactly the same size as the algorithm block size. * For Password Based Encryption Algorithms: This is the binary Salt value to transform the password into a key.

parameter.name: iterations
parameter.help: The number of iterations to transform the password into a binary key. Specify this parameter to adjust ColdFusion encryption to match the details of other encryption software. If you specify this parameter, you must also specify the algorithm parameter with a Password Based Encryption (PBE) algorithm. Do not specify this parameter for Block Encryption Algorithms. You must use the same value to encrypt and decrypt the data. * For Password Based Encryption Algorithms: This is the binary Salt value to transform the password into a key.

function.name: evaluate
function.help: Evaluates one or more string expressions, dynamically, from left to right. (The results of an evaluation on the left can have meaning in an expression to the right.) Returns the result of evaluating the rightmost expression.

function.name: exp
function.help: Calculates the exponent whose base is e that represents number. The constant e equals 2.71828182845904, the base of the natural logarithm. This function is the inverse of Log, the natural logarithm of number.

function.name: expandPath
function.help: Creates an absolute, platform-appropriate path that is equivalent to the value of relative_path, appended to the base path. This function (despite its name) can accept an absolute or relative path in the relative_path attribute

function.name: fileExists
function.help: Determines whether a file exists

function.name: fileIsEOF
function.help: Determines whether ColdFusion has reached the end of the file while reading it.

parameter.name: fileObject
parameter.help: The file object.

function.name: find
function.help: Finds the first occurrence of a substring in a string, from a specified start position. The search is case-sensitive.

function.name: findNoCase
function.help: Finds the first occurrence of a substring in a string, from a specified start position. If substring is not in string, returns zero. The search is case-insensitive.

function.name: findOnEOF
function.help: Finds the first occurrence of any one of a set of characters in a string, from a specified start position. The search is case-sensitive.

function.name: firstDayOfMonth
function.help: Determines the ordinal (day number, in the year) of the first day of the month in which a given date falls.

function.name: fix
function.help: Converts a real number to an integer.

function.name: formatBaseN
function.help: String Converts number to a string, in the base specified by radix. For example: #FormatBaseN(1024,16)#

function.name: generateSecretKey
function.help: Gets a secure key value for use in the encrypt function.

function.name: getAuthUser
function.help: Gets the name of an authenticated user.

function.name: getBaseTagData
function.help: Used within a custom tag. Finds calling (ancestor) tag by name and accesses its data.

function.name: getBaseTagList
function.help: Gets ancestor tag names, starting with the parent tag.

function.name: getBaseTemplatePath
function.help: Gets the absolute path of an application's base page.

function.name: getClientVariablesList
function.help: Finds the client variables to which a page has write access. Comma-delimited list of non-read-only client variables

function.name: getComponentMetadata
function.help: Gets metadata (such as the functions and implemented interfaces of a component) for a CFC or ColdFusion interface.

parameter.name: path
parameter.help: The dot-delimited path of the interface or CFC definition.

function.name: getContextRoot
function.help: Returns path to the J2EE server context root for the current request.

function.name: getCurrentTemplatePath
function.help: Gets the absolute path of the page that calls this function.

function.name: getDirectoryFromPath
function.help: Extracts a directory from an absolute path. Returns the absolute path, without the filename.

function.name: getEncoding
function.help: Returns the encoding (character set) of the Form or URL scope.

function.name: getException
function.help: Used with the cftry and cfcatch tags. Retrieves a Java exception object from a Java object.

function.name: getFileFromPath
function.help: Extracts a filename from an absolute path.

function.name: getFunctionList
function.help: Displays a list of the functions that are available in CFML.

function.name: getGatewayHelper
function.help: Gets a Java GatewayHelper object that provides methods and properties for use with a ColdFusion event gateway.

parameter.name: gatewayID
parameter.help: Identifier of the gateway that provides the GatewayHelper object.

function.name: getHTTPRequestData
function.help: Makes HTTP request headers and body available to CFML pages. Useful for capturing SOAP request data, which can be delivered in an HTTP header.

function.name: getHTTPTimeString
function.help: Gets the current time, in the Universal Time code (UTC).

function.name: getK2ServerDocCount
function.help:
This function is deprecated.
Determines the number of documents that can be searched by the CFML registered K2 Server. This function is used primarily by the CFML Verity and K2Server Administrator pages, and requires significant processing time. Avoid using it in production applications. This function uses Verity K2Server Release K2.2.0.

function.name: getK2ServerDoccountLimit
function.help:
This function is deprecated.
Gets the maximum number of documents that the CFML registered K2 Server is permitted to return from a search. This function is used primarily by the CFML Verity and K2Server Administrator pages. This function uses Verity K2Server Release K2.2.0.

function.name: getLocale
function.help: Gets the current geographic/language locale value. To set the default display format of date, time, number, and currency values in a CFML application session, you use the SetLocale function.

function.name: getLocaleDisplayName
function.help: Gets a locale value and displays the name in a manner that is appropriate to a specific locale. By default, gets the current locale in the current locale's language.

function.name: getLocalhostIP
function.help: Returns the localhost IP address, which is 127.0.0.1 for IPv4 and ::1 for IPv6 addresses.

function.name: getMetadata
function.help: Gets metadata (the methods, properties, and parameters of a component) associated with an object that is deployed on the CFML server.

function.name: getMetricData
function.help: Gets server performance metrics [mode - quicky] perf_monitor - Returns internal data, in a structure. simple_load - Returns an integer value that is computed from the state of the server's internal queues. Indicates the overall server load. prev_req_time - Returns the time, in milliseconds, that it took the server to process the previous request. avg_req_time - Returns the average time, in milliseconds, that it takes the server to process a request.

function.name: getPageContext
function.help: Gets the current CFML MX PageContext object that provides access to page attributes and configuration, request and response objects.

function.name: getProfileSections
function.help: Gets all the sections of an initialization file. An initialization file, as a struct whose format is as follows: - Each initialization file section name is a key in the struct - Each list of entries in a section of an initialization file is a value in the struct

function.name: getProfileString
function.help: Gets an initialization file entry. An initialization file assigns values to configuration variables, also known as entries, that are set when the system boots, the operating system comes up, or an application starts. Returns the entry - if no value, returns an empty string.

function.name: getSOAPRequest
function.help: Returns an XML object that contains the entire SOAP request. Usually called from within a web service CFC.

function.name: getSOAPRequestHeader
function.help: Obtains a SOAP request header. Call only from within a CFC web service function that is processing a request as a SOAP web service.

parameter.name: namespace
parameter.help: A String that is the namespace for the header

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: A String that is the name of the header

parameter.name: asXML
parameter.help: If True, the header is returned as a CFML XML object; if false (default), the header is returned as a Java object.

function.name: getSOAPResponse
function.help: Returns an XML object that contains the entire SOAP response after invoking a web service.

parameter.name: webservice
parameter.help: A webservice object as returned from the cfobject tag or the CreateObject function.

function.name: getSOAPResponseHeader
function.help: Returns a SOAP response header. Call this function from within code that is invoking a web service after making a web service request.

parameter.name: webservice
parameter.help: A webservice object as returned from the cfobject tag or the Createobject function.

parameter.name: namespace
parameter.help: A String that is the namespace for the header.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: A String that is the name of the SOAP header.

parameter.name: asXML
parameter.help: If True, the header is returned as a CFML XML object; if false (default), the header is returned as a Java object.

function.name: getTempDirectory
function.help: Gets the path of the directory that CFML uses for temporary files. Before using this function in an application, test to determine the directory it returns under your account. Returns the absolute pathname of a directory, including a trailing slash.

function.name: getTempFile
function.help: Creates a temporary file in a directory whose name starts with (at most) the first three characters of prefix.

function.name: getTemplatePath
function.help:
This function is deprecated.
Use the GetBaseTemplatePath function instead.

function.name: getTickCount
function.help: Returns the current value of an internal millisecond timer.

function.name: getTimezoneInfo
function.help: Gets local time zone information for the computer on which it is called, relative to Universal Time Coordinated (UTC). UTC is the mean solar time of the meridian of Greenwich, England.

function.name: getToken
function.help: Determines whether a token of the list in the delimiters parameter is present in a string. Returns the token found at position index of the string, as a string. If index is greater than the number of tokens in the string, returns an empty string.

function.name: getUserRoles
function.help: Retrieves the list of roles for the current user.

function.name: getVFSMetadata
function.help: Returns metadata for VFS

function.name: hash
function.help: Converts a variable-length string to a 32-byte, hexadecimal string, using the MD5 algorithm. (It is not possible to convert the hash result back to the source string.) 32-byte, hexadecimal string

parameter.name: encoding
parameter.help: A string specifying the encoding to use when converting the string to byte data used by the hash algorithm. Must be a character encoding name recognized by the Java runtime.

function.name: hour
function.help: Gets the current hour of the day. Ordinal value of the hour, in the range 0 - 23.

function.name: htmlCodeFormat
function.help:
Replaces special characters in a string with their HTML-escaped equivalents and inserts 
 and
tags at the beginning and end of the string. [version] HTML version to use. currently ignored. -1: The latest implementation of HTML 2.0: HTML 2.0 (Default) 3.2: HTML 3.2

function.name: htmlEditFormat
function.help: Replaces special characters in a string with their HTML-escaped equivalents. [version] HTML version to use. currently ignored. -1: The latest implementation of HTML 2.0: HTML 2.0 (Default) 3.2: HTML 3.2

function.name: iIf
function.help: Evaluates a Boolean conditional dynamic expression. Depending on whether the expression is true or false, dynamically evaluates one of two string expressions and returns the result.

function.name: incrementValue
function.help: Adds one to an integer. same as x=x+1 Why bother?

function.name: inputBaseN
function.help: Converts string, using the base specified by radix, to an integer. For example: #InputBaseN("3ff",16)#

function.name: insert
function.help: Inserts a substring in a string after a specified character position. If position = 0, prefixes the substring to the string.

function.name: int
function.help: Calculates the closest integer that is smaller than number.

function.name: isArray
function.help: Determines whether a value is an array. True, if value is an array, a query column object, or xml. also number = Dimension; function tests whether the array has exactly this dimension

function.name: isBinary
function.help: Determines whether a value is stored as binary data.

function.name: isBoolean
function.help: Determines whether a value can be converted to Boolean

function.name: isCustomFunction
function.help: Determines whether a name represents a custom function

function.name: isDate
function.help: Determines whether a string or Java object can be converted to a date/time value.

function.name: isDebugMode
function.help: Determines whether debugging output is enabled.

function.name: isInstanceOf
function.help: Determines whether an object is an instance of a Coldfusion interface or component, or of a Java class.

parameter.name: object
parameter.help: The CFC instance or Java object that you are testing

parameter.name: typename
parameter.help: The name of the interface, component, or Java class of which the object might be an instance

function.name: isJSON
function.help: Evaluates whether a string is in valid JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) data interchange format.

parameter.name: var
parameter.help: A string or variable that represents one.

function.name: isDefined
function.help: Evaluates a string value to determine whether the variable named in it exists.

function.name: isLeapYear
function.help: Determines whether a year is a leap year.

function.name: isLocalhost
function.help: Determines whether the specified IP address is the localhost.

parameter.name: ipaddress
parameter.help: Valid IP address.

function.name: isNumeric
function.help: Determines whether a string can be converted to a numeric value. Supports numbers in U.S. number format. For other number support use LSIsNumeric.

function.name: isNumericDate
function.help: Evaluates whether a real number is a valid representation of a date (date/time object).

function.name: isObject
function.help: Determines whether a value is an object. True, if the value represents a CFML object. False if the value is any other type of data, such as an integer, string, date, or struct.

function.name: isPDFObject
function.help: Determines whether a value is a PDF object.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: A value, typically the PDF object stored as a variable name.

function.name: isQuery
function.help: Determines whether value is a query.

function.name: isSimpleValue
function.help: Determines the type of a value.

function.name: isSOAPRequest
function.help: Determines whether a CFC is being called as a web service.

function.name: isStruct
function.help: Determines whether a variable is a structure. True, if variable is a CFML structure or is a Java object that implements the java.lang.Map interface. Returns False if the object in variable is a user-defined function (UDF).

function.name: isUserInRole
function.help: Determines whether an authenticated user belongs to the specified Role.

function.name: isUserLoggedIn
function.help: Determines whether a user is logged in.

function.name: isValid
function.help: Tests whether a value meets a validation or data type rule.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: The valid format for the data.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: The value to test.

parameter.name: min
parameter.help: The minimum valid value; used only for range validation.

parameter.name: max
parameter.help: The maximum valid value; used only for range validation.

parameter.name: pattern
parameter.help: A regular expression that the parameter must match; used only for regex or regular_expression validation.

function.name: isWDDX
function.help: Determines whether a value is a well-formed WDDX packet.

function.name: isXML
function.help: Determines whether a string is well-formed XML text.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: A string containing the XML document text.

function.name: isXMLAttribute
function.help: Determines whether the function parameter is an XML Document Object Model (DOM) attribute node.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Name of an XML attribute.

function.name: isXMLDoc
function.help: Determines whether a function parameter is an Extended Markup language (XML) document object.

function.name: isXMLElem
function.help: Determines whether a function parameter is an Extended Markup language (XML) document object element.

function.name: isXMLNode
function.help: Determines whether the function parameter is an XML document object node.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Name of an XML document object node.

function.name: isXMLRoot
function.help: Determines whether a function parameter is the root element of an Extended Markup language (XML) document object.

function.name: javacast
function.help: Converts the data type of a CFML variable to pass as an argument to an overloaded method of a Java object. Use only for scalar and string arguments. [type - quicky] boolean,int,long,float,double,string

function.name: jsStringFormat
function.help: Escapes special JavaScript characters, such as single quotation mark, double quotation mark, and newline

function.name: lCase
function.help: Converts the alphabetic characters in a string to lowercase.

function.name: left
function.help: Returns the leftmost count characters in a string.

function.name: len
function.help: Determines the length of a string or binary object

function.name: listAppend
function.help: Concatenates a list or element to a list.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: An element or a list of elements.

function.name: listChangeDelims
function.help: Changes a list delimiter. Returns a copy of the list, with each delimiter character replaced by new_delimiter.

function.name: listContains
function.help: Determines the index of the first list element that contains a specified substring. Returns the index of the first list element that contains substring. If not found, returns zero.

function.name: listContainsNoCase
function.help: Determines the index of the first list element that contains a specified substring.

function.name: listDeleteAt
function.help: Deletes an element from a list. Returns a copy of the list, without the specified element.

function.name: listFind
function.help: Determines the index of the first list element in which a specified value occurs. Case-sensitive

function.name: listFindNoCase
function.help: Determines the index of the first list element in which a specified value occurs

function.name: listFirst
function.help: Gets the first element of a list.

function.name: listGetAt
function.help: Gets a list element at a specified position.

function.name: listInsertAt
function.help: Inserts an element in a list.

function.name: listLast
function.help: Gets the last element of a list.

function.name: listLen
function.help: Determines the number of elements in a list.

function.name: listPrepend
function.help: Inserts an element at the beginning of a list.

function.name: listQualify
function.help: Inserts a string at the beginning and end of list elements.

function.name: listRest
function.help: Gets a list, without its first element.

function.name: listSetAt
function.help: Replaces the contents of a list element.

function.name: listSort
function.help: Sorts list elements according to a sort type and sort order. Returns a sorted copy of the list. [sort_type - quicky] numeric: sorts numbers text: sorts text alphabetically, taking case into account - aabzABZ, if sort_order = "asc" - ZBAzbaa, if sort_order = "desc" textnocase: sorts text alphabetically, without regard to case - aAaBbBzzZ, in an asc sort; - ZzzBbBaAa, in a desc sort;

function.name: listToArray
function.help: Copies the elements of a list to an array.

parameter.name: includeEmptyFields
parameter.help: A Boolean value specifying whether to create empty array entries if there are two delimiters in a row.

parameter.name: multiCharacterDelimiter
parameter.help: A Boolean value specifying whether the delimiters parameter specifies a multi-character delimiter.

function.name: listValueCount
function.help: Counts instances of a specified value in a list. The search is case-sensitive.

function.name: listValueCountNoCase
function.help: Counts instances of a specified value in a list. The search is case-insensitive.

function.name: lJustify
function.help: Left justifies characters in a string of a specified length.

function.name: location
function.help: Stops execution of the current page and opens a CFML page or HTML file.

parameter.name: url
parameter.help: URL of HTML file or CFML page to open.

parameter.name: addtoken
parameter.help: clientManagement must be enabled (see cfapplication).

parameter.name: statuscode
parameter.help: The HTTP status code

function.name: log
function.help: Calculates the natural logarithm of a number. Natural logarithms are based on the constant e (2.71828182845904).

function.name: log10
function.help: Calculates the logarithm of number, to base 10.

function.name: lsCurrencyFormat
function.help: Formats a number in a locale-specific currency format. For countries that use the euro, the result depends on the JVM. [type - quicky] local: the currency format and currency symbol used locally. - With JDK 1.3, the default for Euro Zone: local currency. - With JDK 1.4, the default for Euro Zone: euro. international: the international standard currency format none: the local currency format; no currency symbol

function.name: lsDateFormat
function.help: Formats the date part of a date/time value in a locale-specific format. [mask - quicky] d,dd,ddd,dddd: Day of month / week m,mm,mmm,mmmm: Month; y,yy,yyyy: Year; gg: Period/era string short / medium / long / full

function.name: lsEuroCurrencyFormat
function.help: Formats a number in a locale-specific currency format. [type - quicky] local: the currency format used in the locale. (Default.) international: the international standard currency format none: the currency format used; no currency symbol

function.name: lsIsCurrency
function.help: Determines whether a string is a valid representation of a currency amount in the current locale.

function.name: lsIsDate
function.help: Determines whether a string is a valid representation of a date/time value in the current locale.

function.name: lsIsNumeric
function.help: Determines whether a string is a valid representation of a number in the current locale.

function.name: isNull
function.help: Determines whether given object is null or not

function.name: lsNumberFormat
function.help: Formats a number in a locale-specific format. [mask - quicky] _,9 Digit placeholder; . decimal point; 0 Pads with zeros; ( ) less than zero, puts parentheses around the mask + plus sign before positive number minus before negative - a space before positive minus sign before negative , Separates every third decimal place with a comma. L,C Left-justifies or center-justifies number $ dollar sign before formatted number. ^ Separates left and right formatting.

function.name: lsParseCurrency
function.help: Converts a locale-specific currency string into a formatted number. Attempts conversion by comparing the string with each the three supported currency formats (none, local, international) and using the first that matches.

function.name: lsParseDateTime
function.help: Converts a string that is a valid date/time representation in the current locale into a date/time object.

function.name: lsParseEuroCurrency
function.help: Formats a locale-specific currency string as a number. Attempts conversion through each of the default currency formats (none, local, international). Ensures correct handling of euro currency for Euro zone countries.

function.name: lsParseNumber
function.help: Converts a string that is a valid numeric representation in the current locale into a formatted number.

function.name: lsTimeFormat
function.help: Formats the time part of a date/time string into a string in a locale-specific format. [mask - quicky] h,hh,H,HH: Hours; m,mm: Minutes; s,ss: Seconds; l: Milliseconds; t: A or P; tt: AM or PM "short" = h:mm tt; "medium" = h:mm:ss tt

function.name: lTrim
function.help: Removes leading spaces from a string.

function.name: max
function.help: Determines the greater of two numbers.

function.name: mid
function.help: Extracts a substring from a string.

parameter.name: String
parameter.help: The string from which the substring will be extracted.

parameter.name: start
parameter.help: The position of the first character to retrieve.

parameter.name: count
parameter.help: The number of characters to retrieve.

function.name: min
function.help: Determines the lesser of two numbers.

function.name: minute
function.help: Extracts the minute value from a date/time object.

function.name: month
function.help: Extracts the month value from a date/time object.

function.name: now
function.help: Gets the current date and time of the computer running the CFML server.

function.name: numberFormat
function.help: Creates a custom-formatted number value. For international number formatting use LSNumberFormat. [mask - quicky] _,9 Digit placeholder; . decimal point; 0 Pads with zeros; ( ) less than zero, puts parentheses around the mask + plus sign before positive number minus before negative - a space before positive minus sign before negative , Separates every third decimal place with a comma. L,C Left-justifies or center-justifies number $ dollar sign before formatted number. ^ Separates left and right formatting.

function.name: paragraphFormat
function.help:
Replaces characters in a string: * Single newline characters (CR/LF sequences) with spaces * Double newline characters with HTML paragraph tags (

)

function.name: parseDateTime
function.help: Parses a date/time string according to the English (U.S.) locale conventions. (To format a date/time string for other locales, use the LSParseDateTime function.)

parameter.name: pop_conversion
parameter.help: - standard: (the default) function does no conversion. - pop: specifies that the date/time string is in POP format, which includes the local time of the sender and a time-zone offset from UTC. ColdFusion applies the offset and returns a value with the UTC time.

function.name: pi
function.help: Gets the mathematical constant p, accurate to 15 digits. The number 3.14159265358979.

function.name: preserveSingleQuotes
function.help:
Prevents CFML from automatically escaping single quotation mark characters that are contained in a variable. CFML does not evaluate the argument.
Note: ColdFusion automatically escapes simple-variable, array-variable, and structure-variable references within a cfquery tag body or block.

parameter.name: variable
parameter.help: Variable that contains a string in which to preserve single quotation marks.

function.name: quarter
function.help: Calculates the quarter of the year in which a date falls.

function.name: queryAddColumn
function.help: Adds a column to a query and populates its rows with the contents of a one-dimensional array. Pads query columns, if necessary, to ensure that all columns have the same number of rows.

parameter.name: datatype
parameter.help: Column data type.

function.name: queryAddRow
function.help: Adds a specified number of empty rows to a query.

function.name: queryNew
function.help: Creates an empty query (query object).

parameter.name: columnlist
parameter.help: A string or a variable that contains one. Delimited list of column names, or an empty string.

parameter.name: columntypelist
parameter.help: Comma-delimited list specifying column data types.

function.name: querySetCell
function.help: Sets a cell to a value. If no row number is specified, the cell on the last row is set.

function.name: quotedValueList
function.help: Gets the values of each record returned from an executed query. CFML does not evaluate the arguments

function.name: rand
function.help: Generates a pseudo-random number in the range 0 - 1.

parameter.name: algorithm
parameter.help: The algorithm to use to generated the random number.

function.name: randomize
function.help: Seeds the pseudo-random number generator with an integer number, ensuring repeatable number patterns.

parameter.name: algorithm
parameter.help: The algorithm to use to generated the random number.

function.name: randRange
function.help: Generates a random integer between two specified numbers. Requests for random integers that are greater than 100,000,000 result in non-random numbers, to prevent overflow during internal computations.

parameter.name: algorithm
parameter.help: The algorithm to use to generated the random number.

parameter.name: String
parameter.help: A string or a variable that contains one. String in which to search.

parameter.name: returnsubexpressions
parameter.help: True: if the regular expression is found, the first array element contains the length and position, respectively, of the first match. If the regular expression contains parentheses that group subexpressions, each subsequent array element contains the length and position, respectively, of the first occurrence of each group. If the regular expression is not found, the arrays each contain one element with the value 0. False: the function returns the position in the string where the match begins. Default.

function.name: refindNoCase
function.help: Uses a regular expression (RE) to search a string for a pattern, starting from a specified position. The search is case-insensitive.

parameter.name: String
parameter.help: A string or a variable that contains one. String in which to search.

parameter.name: returnsubexpressions
parameter.help: True: if the regular expression is found, the first array element contains the length and position, respectively, of the first match. If the regular expression contains parentheses that group subexpressions, each subsequent array element contains the length and position, respectively, of the first occurrence of each group. If the regular expression is not found, the arrays each contain one element with the value 0. False: the function returns the position in the string where the match begins. Default.

function.name: rematch
function.help: Uses a regular expression (RE) to search a string for a pattern, starting from a specified position.

parameter.name: reg_expression
parameter.help: Regular expression for which to search. Case sensitive.

parameter.name: string
parameter.help: A string or a variable that contains one. String in which to search.

function.name: reMatchNoCase
function.help: Uses a regular expression (RE) to search a string for a pattern, starting from a specified position.

parameter.name: reg_expression
parameter.help: Regular expression for which to search. Case insensitive.

parameter.name: string
parameter.help: A string or a variable that contains one. String in which to search.

function.name: releaseCOMObject
function.help: Releases a COM Object and frees up resources that it used.

function.name: removeChars
function.help: Removes characters from a string.

function.name: repeatString
function.help: Creates a string that contains a specified number of repetitions of the specified string.

function.name: replace
function.help: Replaces occurrences of substring1 in a string with substring2, in a specified scope. The search is case-sensitive.

parameter.name: scope
parameter.help: * one: replace the first occurrence (default) * all: replace all occurrences

function.name: replaceList
function.help: Replaces occurrences of the elements from a delimited list in a string with corresponding elements from another delimited list. The search is case-sensitive.

function.name: replaceNoCase
function.help: Replaces occurrences of substring1 with substring2, in the specified scope. The search is case-insensitive.

parameter.name: String
parameter.help: A string (or variable that contains one) within which to replace substring

parameter.name: scope
parameter.help: * one: Replace the first occurrence (default) * all: Replace all occurrences

function.name: rereplace
function.help: Uses a regular expression (RE) to search a string for a string pattern and replace it with another. The search is case-sensitive.

parameter.name: String
parameter.help: A string or a variable that contains one

parameter.name: reg_expression
parameter.help: Regular expression to replace.

parameter.name: substring
parameter.help: A string or a variable that contains one. Replaces reg_expression

parameter.name: scope
parameter.help: * one: Replace the first occurrence of the regular expression. Default. * all: Replace all occurrences of the regular expression.

function.name: rereplaceNoCase
function.help: Uses a regular expression to search a string for a string pattern and replace it with another. The search is case-insensitive.

parameter.name: String
parameter.help: A string or a variable that contains one

parameter.name: reg_expression
parameter.help: Regular expression to replace.

parameter.name: substring
parameter.help: A string or a variable that contains one. Replaces reg_expression

parameter.name: scope
parameter.help: * one: Replace the first occurrence of the regular expression. Default. * all: Replace all occurrences of the regular expression.

function.name: reverse
function.help: Reverses the order of items, such as the characters in a string, the digits in a number, or the elements in an array.

parameter.name: String
parameter.help: A string or a variable that contains one

function.name: right
function.help: Gets a specified number of characters from a string, beginning at the right.

parameter.name: count
parameter.help: A positive integer or a variable that contains one. Number of characters to return.

function.name: rJustify
function.help: Right justifies characters of a string.

function.name: round
function.help: Rounds a number to the closest integer.

function.name: rTrim
function.help: Removes spaces from the end of a string.

parameter.name: String
parameter.help: A string or a variable that contains one

function.name: second
function.help: Extracts the ordinal for the second from a date/time object.

parameter.name: date
parameter.help: A date/time object

function.name: sendGatewayMessage
function.help: Sends an outgoing message through a ColdFusion MX event gateway.

parameter.name: gatewayID
parameter.help: Identifier of the gateway to send the message.

parameter.name: data
parameter.help: A ColdFusion structure.

function.name: serializeJSON
function.help: Converts ColdFusion data into a JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) representation of the data.

parameter.name: var
parameter.help: A ColdFusion data value or variable that represents one.

parameter.name: serializeQueryByColumns
parameter.help: A Boolean value that specifies how to serialize ColdFusion queries.

function.name: setEncoding
function.help: Sets the character encoding (character set) of Form and URL scope variable values; used when the character encoding of the input to a form, or the character encoding of a URL, is not in UTF-8 encoding.

parameter.name: charset
parameter.help: The character encoding in which text in the scope variables is encoded.

function.name: setLocale
function.help: Sets the country/language locale for CFML processing and the page returned to the client. The locale value determines the default format of date, time, number, and currency values, according to language and regional conventions.

parameter.name: new_locale
parameter.help: The name of a locale; for example, "English (US)"

function.name: setProfileString
function.help: Sets the value of a profile entry in an initialization file.

parameter.name: inipath
parameter.help: Absolute path of initialization file

parameter.name: section
parameter.help: Section of the initialization file in which the entry is to be set

parameter.name: entry
parameter.help: Name of the entry to set

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Value to which to set the entry

function.name: setVariable
function.help: This function is no longer required in well-formed CFML pages. Sets a variable in the name parameter to the value of the value parameter.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Variable name

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: A string, the name of a string, or a number

function.name: sgn
function.help: Determines the sign of a number.

function.name: sin
function.help: Calculates the sine of an angle that is entered in radians.

function.name: spanExcluding
function.help: Gets characters from a string, from the beginning to a character that is in a specified set of characters. The search is case-sensitive.

parameter.name: set
parameter.help: A string or a variable that contains a set of characters. Must contain one or more characters

function.name: spanIncluding
function.help: Gets characters from a string, from the beginning to a character that is not in a specified set of characters. The search is case-sensitive.

parameter.name: set
parameter.help: A string or a variable that contains a set of characters. Must contain one or more characters

function.name: sqr
function.help: Calculates the square root of a number.

parameter.name: number
parameter.help: A positive integer or a variable that contains one. Number whose square root to get.

function.name: stripCR
function.help: Deletes return characters from a string.

parameter.name: String
parameter.help: A string or a variable that contains one

function.name: structAppend
function.help: Appends one structure to another. CFML MX: Changed behavior: this function can be used on XML objects.

parameter.name: struct1
parameter.help: Structure to append.

parameter.name: struct2
parameter.help: Structure that contains the data to append to struct1

parameter.name: overwriteFlag
parameter.help: Yes: values in struct2 overwrite corresponding values in struct1. Default.

function.name: structClear
function.help: Removes all data from a structure.

parameter.name: structure
parameter.help: Structure to clear

function.name: structCopy
function.help: Copies a structure. Copies top-level keys, values, and arrays in the structure by value; copies nested structures by reference.

parameter.name: structure
parameter.help: Structure to copy

function.name: structCount
function.help: Counts the keys in a structure.

parameter.name: structure
parameter.help: Structure to access

function.name: structDelete
function.help: Removes an element from a structure.

parameter.name: structure
parameter.help: Structure or a variable that contains one. Contains element to remove

parameter.name: key
parameter.help: Element to remove

function.name: structFind
function.help: Determines the value associated with a key in a structure.

parameter.name: structure
parameter.help: Structure that contains the value to return

parameter.name: key
parameter.help: Key whose value to return

function.name: structFindKey
function.help: Searches recursively through a substructure of nested arrays, structures, and other elements, for structures whose values match the search key in the value parameter.

parameter.name: top
parameter.help: CFML object (structure or array) from which to start search. This attribute requires an object, not a name of an object.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: String or a variable that contains one for which to search.

parameter.name: scope
parameter.help: * one: returns one matching key. Default. * all: returns all matching keys

function.name: structFindValue
function.help: Searches recursively through a substructure of nested arrays, structures, and other elements for structures with values that match the search key in the value parameter.

parameter.name: top
parameter.help: CFML object (a structure or an array) from which to start search. This attribute requires an object, not a name of an object.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: String or a variable that contains one for which to search. The type must be a simple object. Arrays and structures are not supported.

parameter.name: scope
parameter.help: one: function returns one matching key (default) all: function returns all matching keys

function.name: structGet
function.help: Gets a structure(s) from a specified path.

parameter.name: pathdesired
parameter.help: Pathname of variable that contains structure or array from which CFML retrieves structure

function.name: structInsert
function.help: Inserts a key-value pair into a structure.

parameter.name: structure
parameter.help: Structure to contain the new key-value pair.

parameter.name: key
parameter.help: Key that contains the inserted value.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Value to add.

parameter.name: allowoverwrite
parameter.help: Whether to allow overwriting a key. Default: False.

function.name: structIsEmpty
function.help: Determines whether a structure contains data.

parameter.name: structure
parameter.help: Structure to test

function.name: structKeyArray
function.help: Finds the keys in a CFML structure. An array of keys; if structure does not exist, CFML throws an exception.

function.name: structKeyExists
function.help: Determines whether a specific key is present in a structure.

parameter.name: structure
parameter.help: Name of structure to test

parameter.name: key
parameter.help: Key to test

function.name: structKeyList
function.help: Extracts keys from a CFML structure.

parameter.name: structure
parameter.help: Structure from which to extract a list of keys

parameter.name: delimiter
parameter.help: Character that separates keys in list. Default: comma.

function.name: structNew
function.help: Creates a structure.

function.name: structSort
function.help: Returns a sorted array of the top level keys in a structure. Sorts using alphabetic or numeric sorting, and can sort based on the values of any structure element.

parameter.name: sorttype
parameter.help: * numeric * text: case sensitive Default. * textnocase

parameter.name: sortorder
parameter.help: * asc: ascending (a to z) sort order. Default. * desc: descending (z to a) sort order

parameter.name: pathtosubelement
parameter.help: String or a variable that contains one

function.name: structUpdate
function.help: Updates a key with a value.

parameter.name: structure
parameter.help: Structure to update

parameter.name: key
parameter.help: Key, the value of which to update

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: New value

function.name: tan
function.help: Calculates the tangent of an angle that is entered in radians.

parameter.name: number
parameter.help: Angle, in radians, for which to calculate the tangent

function.name: throw
function.help: Throws a developer-specified exception, which can be caught with a cfcatch tag that has any of the following type attribute options: type = "custom_type" type = "Application" type = "Any"

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: * A custom type * Application Do not enter another predefined type; types are not generated by CFML applications. If you specify Application, you need not specify a type for cfcatch.

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Message that describes exception event.

parameter.name: detail
parameter.help: Description of the event. CFML appends error position to description; server uses this parameter if an error is not caught by your code.

parameter.name: errorcode
parameter.help: A custom error code that you supply.

parameter.name: extendedinfo
parameter.help: A custom error code that you supply.

parameter.name: object
parameter.help:
Requires the value of the cfobject tag name attribute.
Throws a Java exception from a CFML tag.
This attribute is mutually exclusive with all other attributes of this tag.

function.name: timeFormat
function.help: Formats a time value using US English time formatting conventions. If no mask is specified, returns a time value using the hh:mm tt format. For international time formatting, see LSTimeFormat. [mask] h,hh,H,HH: Hours; m,mm: Minutes; s,ss: Seconds; l: Milliseconds; t: A or P; tt: AM or PM "short" = h:mm tt; "medium" = h:mm:ss tt

parameter.name: time
parameter.help: A date/time value or string to convert

parameter.name: mask
parameter.help: Masking characters that determine the format

function.name: toBase64
function.help: Calculates the Base64 representation of a string or binary object. The Base64 format uses printable characters, allowing binary data to be sent in forms and e-mail, and stored in a database or file.

parameter.name: string_or_object
parameter.help: A string, the name of a string, or a binary object.

parameter.name: encoding
parameter.help: For a string, defines how characters are represented in a byte array.

function.name: toBinary
